content: The "Public Housing Asset Management Improvement Act of 2008" may be cited as the short title. It includes revisions to asset management rules and related fees. The "Public Housing Asset Management Improvement Act of 2008" allows public housing agencies to determine reasonable management and related fees without restrictions from the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, unless determined through a negotiated rulemaking process effective after January 1, 2011. Compliance with asset management requirements is not contingent on fee restrictions. The "Public Housing Asset Management Improvement Act of 2008" allows public housing agencies with fewer than 500 units to be exempt from asset management requirements imposed by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The "Public Housing Asset Management Improvement Act of 2008" allows small public housing agencies to retain the same number of projects for operating fund allocation without meeting asset management requirements.
